result.execSummary:
The defendant Amelia J Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work, school and any other purposes. 
Court does not grant electronic monitoring for this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF46.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  Pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge on each count.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amelia J Russell in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM31 & 15CF46
1:32 am. Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Constable states plea agreement.
Attorney Kessler concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Kessler and defendant have received copy of the amended complaint.
Defendant waives reading of amended complaint.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM31
Ct 1: NO CONTEST
Ct 2: NO CONTEST
Ct 3: NO CONTEST

15CF46
Ct 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kessler.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on 15CF46 Ct 1 & 15CM31 Cts 1, 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CM31
Ct 1, 2 & 3: 30 days jail on each count concurrent with each other and with 15CF46 stayed
2 yrs probation with same conditions as 15CF46
Pay costs and DNA surcharge
$100 dollars domestic abuse surcharge on each count
2 days credit on 15CM31
Court grant Huber privileges for work, school and any other purposes
Court does not grant electronic monitoring for this sentence

15CF46
Ct 1: 30 days jail Stayed
24 mos probation
Conditions
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
No abusive contact with A. Luna or his residence.
Participate in any other counselin as necessary if the agent deems it appropriate
Pay court costs plus DNA surcharge and drug abuse surcharge

Defendant Amelia J Russell in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Kessler
Associated with Counts 2 & 3.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Antonio Luna  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Court requires the defendant to go to the Public Defender today, after release.
**Letter allowing contact filed by Antonio Luna 2/4/15**

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse, Violation of 72 hour No Contact provision.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  2/2/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Court requires the defendant to go to the Public Defender today, after release.
